scenarioDescription:
The 30 Ari B Exoplanetary System


Overview

30 Ari B is a star with 1.93 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.41 times its radius. It is located 145.65 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.91 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

30 Ari B is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the 30 Ari B system


30 Ari B b

30 Ari B b was discovered by the Thueringer Landessternwarte Tautenburg observatory, in 2009-12, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.99 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of 30 Ari B b is 4394.760 times the mass of Earth. The radius of 30 Ari B b is 12.300 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, 30 Ari B b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system 30 Ari B, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Thueringer Landessternwarte Tautenburg.
name: 30 Ari B - System With 1 Exoplanet
